CatDescriptText: Miss Rose Perkins, 2814 Centre Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 28, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "What do you think is wrong with the Pittsburgh Pirates? Do you think that they are using their best ball players at all times?" answer reads: "Having lived in Pittsburgh only five years, I might say that I don't believe that a policeman does have the power, but I feel that he should have a free hand."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Rose Perkins wearing light colored button down trench coat with striped lining, standing in front of corner of Roosevelt Hotel with picture of marlin on fishing line, Penn Avenue, with Stanley Theatre in background, Downtown
